comment: Manifest-version details which version of chrome extension we are using(google is not accepting anything new that is not version 3)
comment2: Name, version and description are all shown on the chrome://extensions page and author will be shown if your extension is published to the web store
name: Timer chrome extension
description: Start timers from your web browser
author: somewhatbewildering@youtube.com
comment3: Icons array details which files should be used as the icon for the extension with different image sizes for the web store
comment4: Action array details the default icons for the pinned extensions bar and the default popup when you click on the extension
comment5: Permissions array details what the extension has access to and what APIs it can use
comment6: Ignore that it says unrecognized manifest key in the errors section of chrome://extensions. JSON doesn't allow comments so this is the only way I can do them
